name: lamb couscous
ingredients: 500 g of lamb meat cut into cubes (about 2 cm)
500 g of tomatoes cut into quarters
100 g of onion cut in half
150 g of carrots cut into cubes (about 2 cm)
150 g of zucchini cut into cubes (about 2 cm)
150 g of turnips cut into cubes (about 2 cm)
150 g of pumpkin flesh cut into cubes (about 2 cm)
250 g of canned chickpeas drained (or soaked)
70 g of olive oil (including 30g for the broth)
Spices: 3 tsp of salt, 1 tsp of pepper, 1-2 doses of saffron, 1 level tsp of ras el-hanout, 1 level tsp of ground ginger
2 sprigs of fresh coriander, stemmed and chopped
2 sprigs of fresh flat-leaf parsley, stemmed and chopped
steps: Prepare the broth base: Chop the tomatoes and onion. Add the lamb, salt, pepper, saffron, ras el-hanout, ginger, 30g of olive oil, butter, 250g of water, carrots, zucchini, turnips, and pumpkin.
Cook the broth for 35 minutes in a pot/casserole (bottom of the couscoussier).
Prepare the semolina: Mix the couscous grains with the remaining water (350g), 40g of olive oil, and salt. Cover and let it swell. Fluff by hand.
Add the chickpeas to the broth. Place the couscous grains on the steaming tray and insert it into the Varoma (top of the couscoussier). Steam for 15 minutes.
Serve the couscous with the lamb stew and hot vegetables, sprinkled with chopped coriander.
